item.title: Microseismicity in South Island, New Zealand
item.description: Seismicity rate changes when the stress state in the crust changes. Both seismicity and geodetic data are readily available to us.

item.title: Dieterich-JGR.1994-stress2rate
item.description: A constitutive law for rate of earthquake production and its application to earthquake clustering Authors: [[James H Dieterich]] Source Notes The essential concept of the analysis is the treatment of a seismically active volume of the Earth as having a population of sources that nucleate successive earthquakes to produce observed seismicity.

item.title: Simulate earthquake sequences in 3-D fault systems
item.description: How to create a [[modeling earthquakes|synthetic seismic sequence]]? Surely one can use the statistics to generate one. But we know plates move and faults slide.
